comments: These file contains the database of all events raised by the commons module.
In an ideal world, the common module should not raise any explicit
event, but rather only raise exceptions.
Still, for historic reasons, we still have logs inside the commons model.
Hope that some brave soul will fix this.

authenticated.description: Events while a session is authenticated.

failure.description: Events generated by a failed operation.

file-operation.description: Events generated by file handling operations.

informational.description: Events informing that an action is going to be performed, or containing details about the service state.

local-admin.description: Events generated by Local Admin service.

operational.description: Events generated by internal server functions.

session.description: Event generated by opening and closing connection and establishing authenticated sessions for clients.

ssh.description: Events generated by SSH and SFTP service.

success.description: Events generated by a successful operation.

0.message: Internal message. This should not be visible in log entries.

1000.message: Wrong .* value for option ".*" in section ".*". .*

1002.message: Could not parse the configuration file. .*

1006.message: Could not switch process to local account ".*" for user ".*".

1007.message: Could not open PID file at %s.

1008.message: Could not write PID file at %s.

1009.message: Deleting Unix root folder is not allowed.

1010.message: Could not initialize the logging file. %s

1012.message: Server process could not read the configuration file .*

1014.message: Could not get home folder for user "%s". %s

1015.message: Failed to get primary group for user "%s".

1016.message: Failed to set owner to "%s" for "%s".

1018.message: SQLite database name is not valid. %s.

1019.message: SQLite logger failed to initialize the database. %s.

1020.message: SQLite logger could not end the transaction. %s.

1021.message: Logger failed to call fetch for one of the handlers. %s.

1022.message: SQLite logger is not supported in this version.

1023.message: Wrong value for logger rotation based on time interval. %s.

1024.message: Unknown event with id "%s" and message "%s".
1024.description: Internal event that is only logged.

1025.message: Failed to resolve text for event id "%s" and message "%s".
1025.description: Internal event that is only logged.

1026.message: Failed to initialize logger as account "%s". %s.
1026.description: Error raised when the logger could not be initialized under the configured account.

1027.description: Error raised when the JSON file could not be loaded.

1028.description: Error raised when the JSON file is not well formated.
